intro: Epilobium × prochazkae, commonly known as the hybrid willow herb, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers in racemes, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodland or along stream banks. Epilobium × prochazkae is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
